greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Primorial deflation (denominator) of Doudna-tree.
comment: Like A005940, also this irregular table can be represented as a binary tree:
A194602 gives the positions of nodes that have value 1. They correspond to terms of A005940 that are products of primorials (A025487). The first 2^k nodes contain A000041(k+1) 1's.
a(n) is even if and only if A005940(1+n) occurs in A277569.
mathematica: Array[#2/GCD[#1, #2] & @@ {#, Apply[Times, Map[If[#1 <= 2, 1, NextPrime[#1, -1]]^#2 & @@ # &, FactorInteger[#]]]} &@ Function[p, Times @@ Flatten@ Table[Prime[Count[Flatten[#], 0] + 1]^#[[1, 1]] &@ Take[p, -i], {i, Length[p]}]]@ Partition[Split[Join[IntegerDigits[# - 1, 2], {2}]], 2] &[# + 1] &, 96] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Aug 27 2020 *)
program: A064989(n) = {my(f); f = factor(n); if((n>1 && f[1,1]==2), f[1,2] = 0); for (i=1, #f~, f[i,1] = precprime(f[i,1]-1)); factorback(f)};
xref: A003961, A005940, A006519, A026741, A064989, A319627 are used in a formula defining this sequence.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, _Michael De Vlieger_ and _Peter Munn_, Aug 25 2020
